alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake Valley; Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 7:46PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Salt Lake and northwestern Utah Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 746 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Draper, or near Sandy, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sandy, South Jordan, Lehi, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, Holladay, Herriman, Alpine, Bluffdale, Little Cottonwood Canyon, Little Cottonwood Creek Valley, Granite, Mount Olympus, Big Cottonwood Canyon, Camp Williams, Highland and Snowbird. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 282 and 295. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Salt Lake Valley; Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
